title: Mark Chapter 1 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Mark chapter 1 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Mark Chapter 1 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Mark Chapter 1.

questions.question: Who baptized Jesus in the Jordan River?
questions.correctAnswer: John
questions.explanation: Mark 1:9 states that Jesus was baptized by John in the Jordan River.

questions.question: What did John the Baptist eat while in the wilderness?
questions.correctAnswer: Locusts and wild honey
questions.explanation: Mark 1:6 describes John as eating locusts and wild honey in the wilderness.

questions.question: What did the voice from heaven say to Jesus after He was baptized?
options: Thou art my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased
This is my servant, whom I have chosen
questions.correctAnswer: Thou art my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased
questions.explanation: Mark 1:11 records the voice from heaven declaring Jesus as the beloved Son.

questions.question: How long was Jesus in the wilderness, tempted by Satan?
questions.correctAnswer: 40 days
questions.explanation: Mark 1:13 states Jesus was in the wilderness for forty days, tempted by Satan.

questions.question: What profession did Simon and Andrew have before following Jesus?
questions.correctAnswer: Fishers
questions.explanation: Mark 1:16 says Simon and Andrew were fishers by the sea of Galilee.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jesus said to Simon and Andrew, 'Come ye after me, and I will make you to become ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: fishers of men
questions.explanation: Mark 1:17 quotes Jesus saying He would make them 'fishers of men'.

questions.question: Where did Jesus teach on the Sabbath, causing astonishment by His doctrine?
questions.correctAnswer: Synagogue in Capernaum
questions.explanation: Mark 1:21 mentions Jesus teaching in the synagogue at Capernaum on the Sabbath.

questions.question: What did Jesus do when a man with an unclean spirit cried out in the synagogue?
options: He rebuked the spirit and commanded it to come out
He asked the man to leave
questions.correctAnswer: He rebuked the spirit and commanded it to come out
questions.explanation: Mark 1:25 describes Jesus rebuking the unclean spirit and commanding it to come out.

questions.question: True or False: Mark 1:14 says Jesus began preaching the gospel after John was put in prison.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Mark 1:14 clearly states that Jesus began preaching after John was imprisoned.

questions.question: Who was healed by Jesus by taking her by the hand and lifting her up from a fever?
options: A man with an unclean spirit
questions.correctAnswer: Simon's wife's mother
questions.explanation: Mark 1:30-31 tells how Jesus healed Simon's wife's mother by lifting her up from her fever.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus prayed in a solitary place early in the morning.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Mark 1:35 records Jesus rising early to pray in a solitary place.

questions.question: What did Jesus say was at hand in Mark 1:15?
questions.correctAnswer: The kingdom of God
questions.explanation: Mark 1:15 says, 'The kingdom of God is at hand,' indicating its nearness.

questions.question: Who were the brothers that Jesus called while they were mending their nets?
questions.correctAnswer: James and John
questions.explanation: Mark 1:19-20 records Jesus calling James and John while they were fixing their nets.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus refused to cast out devils because they knew Him.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Mark 1:34 states Jesus cast out many devils and did not allow them to speak because they knew Him.

questions.question: What instruction did Jesus give the man healed of leprosy regarding telling others?
options: See thou say nothing to any man
questions.correctAnswer: See thou say nothing to any man
questions.explanation: Mark 1:43-44 records Jesus commanding the healed leper to say nothing to anyone.

medium.title: Mark Chapter 1 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Mark Chapter 1 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Mark 1 teach us about the importance of obedience and trust in God's calling through the example of the first disciples?
options: They immediately left their work and family to follow Jesus
They hesitated before deciding to follow Jesus
They questioned Jesus about their future before following
They continued their fishing while listening to Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: They immediately left their work and family to follow Jesus
questions.explanation: Mark 1:18-20 shows Simon, Andrew, James, and John immediately forsaking their nets and following Jesus, demonstrating obedience and trust without delay. This teaches us to respond quickly to God's calling.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with temptation and isolation. Based on Mark 1, what biblical truth would you share to encourage them?
options: Jesus was tempted in the wilderness but was ministered to by angels
Jesus never faced temptation or isolation
Jesus immediately escaped temptation without trial
Jesus only preached without personal struggle
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus was tempted in the wilderness but was ministered to by angels
questions.explanation: Mark 1:12-13 reveals Jesus being driven into the wilderness, tempted by Satan for forty days, yet ministered to by angels. This shows believers that perseverance through trials is supported by God's care.

questions.question: How does the baptism of Jesus by John in Mark 1 demonstrate the principle of humility in Christian life?
options: Jesus submitted to baptism even though He was sinless
John baptized himself as a symbol
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus submitted to baptism even though He was sinless
questions.explanation: Mark 1:9-10 shows Jesus coming to John to be baptized, demonstrating humility and obedience despite His sinless nature. This models submission to God's plan for believers.

questions.question: What does the passage about Jesus' early morning prayer in Mark 1 teach about spiritual discipline?
options: Jesus rose early to pray in a solitary place
Jesus prayed publicly with crowds daily
Jesus delegated prayer to His disciples only
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus rose early to pray in a solitary place
questions.explanation: Mark 1:35 illustrates Jesus rising early before dawn to pray alone, emphasizing the importance of personal devotion and spiritual discipline for believers.

questions.question: According to Mark 1, how should believers respond when they see the power of Jesus over evil spirits?
options: With amazement and recognizing His authority
questions.correctAnswer: With amazement and recognizing His authority
questions.explanation: Mark 1:27 shows that people were amazed at Jesus' authority over unclean spirits, acknowledging His divine power, which encourages believers to trust God's authority.

questions.question: How does Jesus' healing of Simon's mother-in-law in Mark 1 model serving others after receiving God's blessing?
options: She was healed and immediately served them
She requested to rest instead of serving
She left to seek medical help elsewhere
She was healed but did not respond
questions.correctAnswer: She was healed and immediately served them
questions.explanation: Mark 1:31 demonstrates that after Jesus healed Simon's mother-in-law, she immediately ministered to them, teaching the value of gratitude expressed through serving others.

questions.question: What does the interaction with the leper in Mark 1 teach us about faith and Jesus’ compassion?
options: The leper's faith led Jesus to heal him out of compassion
Jesus healed only those with perfect faith
Jesus refused to touch the leper
The leper was healed without asking
questions.correctAnswer: The leper's faith led Jesus to heal him out of compassion
questions.explanation: Mark 1:40-41 shows the leper pleading, 'If thou wilt, thou canst make me clean,' and Jesus, moved with compassion, healed him, highlighting the power of faith and compassion.

questions.question: True or False: According to Mark 1, Jesus only preached in Jerusalem and avoided other regions.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Mark 1:14, 38-39 show Jesus preaching throughout Galilee and in various synagogues, not restricting His ministry to Jerusalem.

questions.question: True or False: In Mark 1, John the Baptist claimed he was worthy to untie the latchet of Jesus' shoes.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Mark 1:7 states John said he was not worthy to stoop down and unloose the latchet of Jesus' shoes, showing humility and recognition of Jesus' greater authority.

questions.question: A believer feels overwhelmed by the demands of ministry. Based on Mark 1, what principle about prioritizing ministry and rest can you share?
options: Jesus prayed alone early in the morning before continuing ministry
Jesus never took a break and worked nonstop
Jesus delegated all ministry tasks to others
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus prayed alone early in the morning before continuing ministry
questions.explanation: Mark 1:35-38 shows Jesus withdrawing early to pray and then continuing His mission, teaching the importance of balancing ministry with personal time with God.

questions.question: How does Jesus’ command to His disciples to become 'fishers of men' in Mark 1 teach us about evangelism?
options: It calls believers to actively reach others and share the Gospel
It encourages believers to focus only on their own salvation
It tells believers to avoid public ministry
It emphasizes fishing as a profession only
questions.correctAnswer: It calls believers to actively reach others and share the Gospel
questions.explanation: Mark 1:17 uses the metaphor of fishing to illustrate the disciples’ mission to bring people to faith in Christ, teaching believers about active evangelism.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jesus said, 'The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand: ______ ye, and believe the gospel.'
questions.correctAnswer: Repent
questions.explanation: Mark 1:15 teaches the call to repentance and faith as foundational responses to the gospel message.

questions.question: What does Mark 1 teach about the role of family and work when Jesus called His first disciples?
options: The disciples left their family and work immediately to follow Jesus
They prioritized family and work over following Jesus
They delayed following Jesus to finish their work
They asked permission from family first
questions.correctAnswer: The disciples left their family and work immediately to follow Jesus
questions.explanation: Mark 1:18-20 shows the disciples forsaking their nets and leaving their father’s business without delay, indicating the priority of following Christ even over family and work.

questions.question: How does the spreading fame of Jesus in Mark 1 encourage believers about the impact of faithful service?
options: Jesus’ fame spread quickly as He healed and taught with authority
Jesus only ministered to a few people privately
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus’ fame spread quickly as He healed and taught with authority
questions.explanation: Mark 1:28 and 34 show that Jesus’ ministry attracted widespread attention because of His authoritative teaching and healing, encouraging believers that faithful service can have wide impact.

questions.question: What biblical principle about honesty and integrity can be learned from the baptism and ministry of John in Mark 1?
options: John preached repentance and baptized many confessing their sins
John encouraged hiding sins and avoiding confession
John claimed to be the Messiah
questions.correctAnswer: John preached repentance and baptized many confessing their sins
questions.explanation: Mark 1:4-5 shows John’s call to repentance and public confession through baptism, modeling honesty and integrity before God and others.

hard.title: Mark Chapter 1 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Mark Chapter 1.

questions.question: What Old Testament prophetic role is John the Baptist fulfilling as described in Mark 1?
options: Messenger preparing the way for the Lord
questions.correctAnswer: Messenger preparing the way for the Lord
questions.explanation: Mark 1:2-3 cites prophecy about a messenger preparing the way, aligning John the Baptist with this prophetic role.

questions.question: According to Mark 1, what symbolic act did John perform to initiate repentance among the people?
questions.correctAnswer: Baptism in the Jordan River
questions.explanation: Mark 1:4-5 describes John baptizing people in the Jordan for repentance and remission of sins.

questions.question: How is John the Baptist’s attire described in Mark 1, and what might this indicate about his prophetic identity?
options: Clothed in camel’s hair with a leather girdle
Wearing royal robes and a crown
Clothed in fine linen and purple
questions.correctAnswer: Clothed in camel’s hair with a leather girdle
questions.explanation: Mark 1:6 describes John’s clothing, which aligns with Elijah’s prophetic style, symbolizing asceticism and prophetic authority.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus being baptized by John in the Jordan as narrated in Mark 1:9-11?
options: It marks the divine affirmation of Jesus as God’s Son
It signifies Jesus’ repentance for sins
It fulfills the Mosaic Law of cleansing
questions.correctAnswer: It marks the divine affirmation of Jesus as God’s Son
questions.explanation: Mark 1:10-11 recount the heavens opening and God's voice declaring Jesus as His beloved Son, affirming His divine identity.

questions.question: What literary device is present in the description of the Spirit descending like a dove in Mark 1:10?
questions.correctAnswer: Simile
questions.explanation: The Spirit is described as descending 'like a dove,' a classic simile comparing the Spirit’s descent to a gentle dove.

questions.question: How long was Jesus tempted in the wilderness according to Mark 1, and what Old Testament event does this parallel?
options: Forty days; paralleling Israel’s forty years in the wilderness
Seven days; paralleling creation’s seven days
Three days; paralleling Jonah in the belly of the fish
Twelve days; paralleling the twelve tribes of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Forty days; paralleling Israel’s forty years in the wilderness
questions.explanation: Mark 1:13 states Jesus was tempted for forty days, echoing Israel's forty years, symbolizing testing and preparation.

questions.question: What does Jesus proclaim is at hand in Mark 1:15, and how does this relate to Jewish eschatological expectations?
options: The kingdom of God; signaling the arrival of God's reign
A new temple; fulfilling prophetic restoration
The destruction of Jerusalem; fulfilling judgment
questions.correctAnswer: The kingdom of God; signaling the arrival of God's reign
questions.explanation: Mark 1:15 announces the kingdom of God is near, aligning with Jewish hopes for divine rule and restoration.

questions.question: What is the typological significance of Jesus calling fishermen to follow Him in Mark 1:16-20?
options: He calls them to become 'fishers of men,' symbolizing evangelistic mission
He appoints them as temple priests
He calls them to political leadership
He instructs them to build boats for ministry
questions.correctAnswer: He calls them to become 'fishers of men,' symbolizing evangelistic mission
questions.explanation: Mark 1:17 uses fishing imagery to symbolize the disciples’ new role in gathering people into God's kingdom.

questions.question: How does Mark 1:22 highlight the uniqueness of Jesus’ teaching compared to the scribes?
options: He quotes extensively from the Torah
questions.correctAnswer: He teaches with authority
questions.explanation: Mark 1:22 notes that people were amazed because Jesus taught with inherent authority unlike the scribes who relied on tradition.

questions.question: In Mark 1, what does the reaction to Jesus casting out an unclean spirit in the synagogue reveal about His ministry?
options: He has authority over evil spirits, demonstrating divine power
He relies on the power of the Pharisees
He performs miracles only after the Sabbath
questions.correctAnswer: He has authority over evil spirits, demonstrating divine power
questions.explanation: Mark 1:27 shows amazement at Jesus’ authority to command unclean spirits, validating His divine mission.

questions.question: What cultural and religious practice does Jesus instruct the healed leper to follow in Mark 1:44?
options: Show himself to the priest and offer cleansing sacrifices
Offer alms to the poor immediately
questions.correctAnswer: Show himself to the priest and offer cleansing sacrifices
questions.explanation: Mark 1:44 commands the leper to comply with Mosaic Law by presenting himself to the priest as a testimony.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus rising early to pray in a solitary place as described in Mark 1:35?
options: Demonstrates dependence on the Father and prioritizes prayer
questions.correctAnswer: Demonstrates dependence on the Father and prioritizes prayer
questions.explanation: Mark 1:35 highlights Jesus’ model of spiritual discipline and reliance on God through solitary prayer.

questions.question: The phrase 'He will baptize you with the Holy Ghost' in Mark 1:8 foreshadows which New Testament event?
options: Pentecost and the coming of the Holy Spirit
questions.correctAnswer: Pentecost and the coming of the Holy Spirit
questions.explanation: Mark 1:8 contrasts John's water baptism with the future baptism by the Holy Spirit at Pentecost.

questions.question: True or False: According to Mark 1, Jesus was more powerful than John the Baptist, to the extent that John said he was not worthy to untie Jesus’ shoe latchet.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Mark 1:7 records John acknowledging Jesus’ superiority, stating he was unworthy to untie his shoes.

questions.question: True or False: Following Jesus’ healing of the leper, the man obeyed Jesus’ command to remain silent about his healing as described in Mark 1.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Mark 1:45 states the healed leper disobeyed Jesus by publicly spreading the news, causing Jesus’ limited public access.

theological.title: Mark Chapter 1 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Mark Chapter 1 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What is the theological significance of Jesus being called 'the Son of God' at the beginning of the gospel in Mark 1:1?
options: It affirms Jesus' divine nature and messianic identity
It means Jesus was adopted by God
It suggests Jesus was a prophet only
It implies Jesus was a created being
questions.correctAnswer: It affirms Jesus' divine nature and messianic identity
questions.explanation: Mark 1:1 presents Jesus as the Son of God, affirming His divine nature and messianic role, consistent with Psalm 2:7, Isaiah 9:6, John 1:14, Romans 1:4, and Hebrews 1:3 which affirm His deity and unique sonship.

questions.question: According to Mark 1:4, what was the purpose of John's baptism?
options: To preach repentance for the remission of sins
To initiate people into a secret society
questions.correctAnswer: To preach repentance for the remission of sins
questions.explanation: Mark 1:4 explains John baptized as a call to repentance for the forgiveness of sins, aligning with Old Testament calls to repentance (Isaiah 1:16-18, Joel 2:12-13) and New Testament teachings on forgiveness (Acts 2:38, Luke 24:47, Hebrews 10:22).

questions.question: What does John the Baptist mean when he says he is not worthy to stoop down and unloose the latchet of the shoes of the one coming after him (Mark 1:7)?
options: He acknowledges the superior authority of Jesus
He shows humility but claims equal status
He intends to physically untie shoes
questions.correctAnswer: He acknowledges the superior authority of Jesus
questions.explanation: Mark 1:7 depicts John’s humility and recognition of Jesus’ greater authority, consistent with the prophetic role of the Messiah in Malachi 3:1, Isaiah 40:3, Luke 3:16, and Philippians 2:9-11 emphasizing Christ’s exalted status.

questions.question: How does Mark 1:10-11 describe the divine affirmation of Jesus at His baptism?
options: The heavens opened, the Spirit descended like a dove, and a voice declared Him God's beloved Son
An angel appeared and handed Him a scroll
A cloud covered Him with fire
The earth shook and stones split
questions.correctAnswer: The heavens opened, the Spirit descended like a dove, and a voice declared Him God's beloved Son
questions.explanation: Mark 1:10-11 describes the Trinitarian revelation: the Spirit's descent and the Father's voice affirm Jesus' divine sonship, echoing Psalm 2:7, Isaiah 42:1, Matthew 3:16-17, and John 1:32-34 which underscore the Messianic identity and divine approval.

questions.question: What is the theological significance of Jesus being driven by the Spirit into the wilderness for 40 days as stated in Mark 1:12-13?
options: It symbolizes His preparation and testing for ministry
It indicates His abandonment by God
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes His preparation and testing for ministry
questions.explanation: Mark 1:12-13 shows Jesus’ Spirit-led testing in the wilderness, paralleling Israel’s 40 years (Deuteronomy 8:2), Moses’ time (Exodus 34:28), and Elijah’s experience (1 Kings 19:8), emphasizing preparation and victory over temptation as foundation for His redemptive work (Hebrews 4:15, James 1:12).

questions.question: What central message does Jesus proclaim in Mark 1:14-15 about the kingdom of God?
options: The time is fulfilled, the kingdom is at hand; repent and believe the gospel
The kingdom will come in the distant future
Only the Jewish people will enter the kingdom
The kingdom is a political realm
questions.correctAnswer: The time is fulfilled, the kingdom is at hand; repent and believe the gospel
questions.explanation: Mark 1:14-15 announces the inauguration of God’s kingdom, calling for repentance and faith, consistent with prophetic fulfillment (Daniel 9:24-27), Jesus’ teaching on the kingdom (Matthew 4:17), and the apostolic message (Acts 1:3, Romans 14:17, Revelation 1:6).

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus calling Simon and Andrew to become 'fishers of men' in Mark 1:17?
options: It symbolizes their new mission to gather people into God's kingdom
It means they should catch more fish
It is a metaphor for farming
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes their new mission to gather people into God's kingdom
questions.explanation: In Mark 1:17, Jesus redefines their vocation to evangelism, echoing Old Testament imagery of gathering (Jeremiah 16:16), Jesus’ mission to save (Luke 19:10), and the Great Commission (Matthew 28:19-20), emphasizing discipleship and salvation.

questions.question: How does Mark 1:22 characterize Jesus' teaching compared to the scribes?
options: He taught with authority, not as the scribes
He only quoted the Old Testament
questions.correctAnswer: He taught with authority, not as the scribes
questions.explanation: Mark 1:22 highlights Jesus’ unique authoritative teaching, contrasting with the scribes’ reliance on tradition, consistent with Matthew 7:29, Luke 4:32, John 7:46, and Hebrews 1:1-2, reflecting His divine authority and role as the ultimate teacher.

questions.question: What does the encounter with the unclean spirit in the synagogue (Mark 1:23-26) reveal about Jesus' authority?
options: He commands unclean spirits and they obey Him, showing divine authority
He is afraid of unclean spirits
questions.correctAnswer: He commands unclean spirits and they obey Him, showing divine authority
questions.explanation: Mark 1:23-26 demonstrates Jesus' sovereign authority over demonic powers, affirming His divine power as foretold in Isaiah 61:1, Luke 4:36, Colossians 2:15, and 1 John 3:8, emphasizing His role as the Messiah who triumphs over evil.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus healing Simon’s mother-in-law in Mark 1:30-31?
options: It shows Jesus’ power to heal and restore service
It was a symbolic act with no real healing
It was a private miracle to keep secret
It was the only healing He performed
questions.correctAnswer: It shows Jesus’ power to heal and restore service
questions.explanation: Mark 1:30-31 illustrates Jesus’ healing power, restoring health and enabling service, consistent with His healing ministry in Matthew 8:14-15, Luke 4:38-39, Isaiah 53:4-5, and James 5:14-15, demonstrating divine compassion and authority over sickness.

questions.question: How does Mark 1:34 demonstrate Jesus’ comprehensive ministry?
options: He healed many sick and cast out many demons
questions.correctAnswer: He healed many sick and cast out many demons
questions.explanation: Mark 1:34 shows Jesus’ holistic ministry addressing physical and spiritual needs, fulfilling Isaiah 61:1-3, Matthew 4:23-24, Luke 9:1-2, and Acts 10:38, signifying the in-breaking of God's kingdom and restoration of creation.

questions.question: What does Jesus’ early morning prayer in a solitary place (Mark 1:35) teach about His relationship with God?
options: It shows the importance of communion with the Father
It was a moment of doubt
questions.correctAnswer: It shows the importance of communion with the Father
questions.explanation: Mark 1:35 emphasizes Jesus’ dependence on prayer and intimate fellowship with God, consistent with His teaching in John 5:19, Luke 5:16, Hebrews 5:7, and Philippians 2:5-8, modeling the necessity of prayer for ministry and obedience.

questions.question: What was the response of the people to Jesus’ healing of the leper in Mark 1:40-42?
options: The leper was immediately cleansed after Jesus said 'I will; be thou clean'
The leper was healed after many days
Jesus refused to heal the leper
questions.correctAnswer: The leper was immediately cleansed after Jesus said 'I will; be thou clean'
questions.explanation: Mark 1:40-42 records an instantaneous healing by Jesus’ compassionate word, affirming His divine authority over disease, consistent with Matthew 8:3, Luke 5:13, Isaiah 53:4-5, and Acts 10:38, showcasing His power to restore both physically and spiritually.

questions.question: Why did Jesus command the healed leper to say nothing to anyone and show himself to the priest (Mark 1:43-44)?
options: To fulfill Mosaic Law and avoid public sensationalism
Because He wanted to hide the miracle
To prevent the leper from being healed
questions.correctAnswer: To fulfill Mosaic Law and avoid public sensationalism
questions.explanation: Mark 1:43-44 instructs the leper to comply with Mosaic Law (Leviticus 14:2-32) and avoid premature publicity, consistent with Jesus’ frequent silencing of miracles (Mark 8:30, Luke 5:14), emphasizing order and prophetic fulfillment rather than sensationalism.

questions.question: What theological theme is presented by Jesus’ increasing fame and difficulty entering cities openly as described in Mark 1:45?
options: The tension between Jesus’ ministry and societal opposition
That Jesus wanted to avoid people
questions.correctAnswer: The tension between Jesus’ ministry and societal opposition
questions.explanation: Mark 1:45 reveals the growing popularity and opposition Jesus faced, a theme seen in Isaiah 53:3, John 7:7, Matthew 10:22, and Acts 4:1-3, illustrating the paradox of Messiahship: widespread need and rejection, highlighting the cost of salvation history.
